title: How to add a space character?
content:
This question seems basic but I am not able of including one space character between two words in Fontlab when I make tests of kearning (Preview / Metrics). I follow the Mr. Carbaga manual (Learn Fontlab Fast) : _see page 72 : To add the Space character to a string, type\0020 (then a space..._. I did but nothing happen.   
   
Help please! Thanks
author: sim

comments.content:
\0020 will only work if the space glyph is correctly encoded. If you have a glyph in the font called 'space', try running the Assign Unicode command from the Glyph menu. This will assign Unicode values to glyphs based on their names, following a mapping list (the default will be the STANDARD.NAM file that comes with FontLab).   
   
Also note that in preview and metrics strings etc. you can also enter a glyph by name, using this convention: /space
Thank you for the advice , that works.

Another question: how, could I remove the red measurement line in Fontlab. This line seems to me little useful. Is there anybody who can help me to use it effectively?

Thanks
